{"step_by_step_thinking": "Leeway space is a term used in dentistry, particularly in pediatric dentistry. It refers to the space created in the dental arch during the transition from primary (deciduous) to permanent dentition. This space is created due to the difference in size between the primary and permanent teeth. According to the documents, the leeway space is due to the difference in size between the primary canines and molars and their succedaneous permanent teeth.", "answer_choice": "A"}
